note.p: Birth: Pinkie House, Inveresk parish, Midlothian, Scotland (1685)
Education: Royal Grammar School, Newcastle; Edinburgh. MA (1701)

Career: Minister of the Presbyterian Congregation at Morpeth and Newbiggin-by-the-Sea, Northumberland; kept a school at Morpeth; lectured in natural science at Morpeth and Newcastle; corresponded with Roger Gale (FRS 1717)
Notes: Possible birth place of Newcastle-upon-Tyne, Northumberland. Proposed by James Jurin; William Rutty; Roger Gale; John Eames
